Package eecs1021.lab6

Class Company

  • java.lang.Object
    • eecs1021.lab6.Company
  • public class Company
extends java.lang.Object
    Company Class collect and store information about employee and department The Company class used Java Collections (ArrayList and HashMap)

      • getDepartments

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Department> getDepartments()
        Get the departments inside this company
        Returns:
        a reference to the Map of all the departments exist inside this company

        Get the all employees working inside this company
        Returns:
        a reference to the Map of all the employees working for this company

      • addEmployee

        public void addEmployee​(java.lang.String employeeID,
                        Employee info)
        This method add a new employee to the company. This method does not allow duplicate employee and throws an exception if the employee is already exist in the Company employee
        Parameters:
        employeeID - : id of the new employee
        info - :information object of the new employee
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if 'employeeID' is an existing employee id

      • removeEmployee

        public void removeEmployee​(java.lang.String employeeID)
        Remove an existing employee entry from company and throws an exception if the employee is not exist in the Company employee
        Parameters:
        employeeID - :id of any given employee
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if 'employeeID' is not an existing employee id

      • addDepartment

        public void addDepartment​(java.lang.Integer departmentID,
                          Department info)
        Add a new department entry to the company This method does not allow duplicate department in the company and throws an exception if the department is already exist in the Company department
        Parameters:
        departmentID - :id of the new department
        info - information object of the new department
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if 'departmentID' is an existing department id

      • removeDepartment

        public void removeDepartment​(java.lang.Integer departmentID)
        Remove an existing department entry from the company and throws an exception if the department is not exist among the Company departments
        Parameters:
        departmentID - : id of any given department
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if 'departmentID' is not an existing department id

      • changeEmployeeDepartment

        public void changeEmployeeDepartment​(java.lang.String employeeID,
                                     java.lang.Integer newDepartmentID)
        This method implement employee movement between the company departments. So, it changes the department of employee with id 'employeeID' to a new department ID given by input parameter 'newDepartmentID'. You can assume that 'newDepartmentID' denotes a department ID different from the current department ID of the employee denoted by 'employeeID'.
        Parameters:
        employeeID - : id of a given employee that we need to change his department
        newDepartmentID - : id of a new department
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either employeeID is a non-existing employee id in this company or newDepartmentID is a non-existing department id in this company.

      • getEmployeeName

        public java.lang.String getEmployeeName​(java.lang.String employeeID)
        This method return the name of the employee inside this company. Retrieve the name of employee with id 'employeeID'.
        Parameters:
        employeeID - id of some employee
        Returns:
        name of the employee with id 'employeeID'.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if 'employeeID' is not an existing employee id in this company

      • getEmployeeNames

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getEmployeeNames​(java.lang.Integer departmentID)
        This method collect the names of employee in any given department and return an ArrayList object contains these names.

        Retrieve the names of all employees of the department with id 'departmentID'. If 'departmentID' a non-existing department id in this company, then return an empty list.

        Parameters:
        departmentID - : id of a given department
        Returns:
        ArrayList object of names of employees whose employed (linked ) by a department has id 'departmentID'

      • getDepartmentInfo

        public Department getDepartmentInfo​(java.lang.String employeeID)
        This method return the department information where a given employee working. The employee id is given by input parameter 'employeeID'. Retrieve an employee's department's information object.
        Parameters:
        employeeID - : id of any given employee
        Returns:
        The information object of the employee's department
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if 'employeeID' is not an existing employee id in this company

      • getAverageSalary

        public double getAverageSalary​(java.lang.Integer departmentID)
        This method check the salary of employee in any given department and compute the average salary of all employee belonging to this department.

        Retrieve the average salary of all employees in department with id 'departmentID'.

        Parameters:
        departmentID - : id of any given department
        Returns:
        average salary of all employees in department with id 'departmentID'
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if departmentID is not an existing department id in this company

      • getDepartmentOfHighestAverageSalary

        public Department getDepartmentOfHighestAverageSalary()
        This method determine the department with highest average salary of its employees.

        For each department belonging to this company department, this method compute the average salary of employees. Then return the department that has the highest average salary among the company departments

        In summary, retrieve the information object of the department with the highest average salary among its employees.

        Returns:
        the information object of the department with the highest average salary among its employees Hint: Use 'getAverageSalary(Integer departmentID)' as a helper method.
